info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 27 at 5:16PM MDT until April 27 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTY... At 514 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Genoa, or 11 miles east of Limon, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Genoa and Arriba. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Blowing dust will produce poor visibility, including I-70 between Genoa and Arriba. Use extreme caution as visibility can be quickly reduced in blowing dust, and traffic may be suddenly slowed or stopped. Pull over to the side of the road if dangerous conditions are observed ahead.
